answers.answer: Normal EF is 50% or higher.  Yours is on the low side of normal, but yours is still normal.  Everything coud be normal with your heart, so don't worry about it.  Keep your with the cardiologist.

question: I went to the doctor today and was told that my ejection fraction was 50%.  I am 47 years old, I am 5' 7" and weigh 152...I do not have heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, nor have I ever had Heart failure, cardiomypathy, or a prior heart attack.  My doctor ( general practioner) was stumped as to why my number was this low.( Echocardiogram)The only incident that I could remember was during my first pregnancy for 2-3 months I had Pre-eclampsia, and I had to be hospitalized so that they could bring my blood pressure under control.  Could this prior hypertension incident 18 years ago affect my heart?  I have never had an echo before, so there is nothing to compare it to.  This is my first one.  I have an appointment to see a cardiologist this month, but for right now, I have more questions than answers since I don't seem to have an prior medical conditions that would warrant this....how worried should I be?? I
title: Ejection Fraction
